label: 権僧正
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A Buddhist official, being one of the Buddhist Hierarchy (Sōgō), who holds one of the provisional posts (gon-kan). Those Buddhist priests who held this post and are mentioned in this book are as follows, being listed in the order of their appearance in the text: Ichien, Zōmyō, Kanken, Yokei, Senga, Shin'yo, Myōson, Raishin, Hanshun, Shōkaku, and Kakuchū. [僧綱、権官、壱演、増命、観賢、余慶、暹賀、心誉、明尊、頼信、範俊、勝覚、覚忠]
